oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from James B. Owen to his father
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two-pags of a partial letter from Pvt. James B. Owen, Co. D, 31st Ill. Inf. Regt., USA to his father. He says that they crossed the Mississippi the month before and went below the Grand Gulf where they fought with ironclad gunboats; during the Vicksburg Campaign. Some of note during these battles were the City Class gunboats Pittsburg, Louisville, Carondelet, Mound City, Lafayette, Benton, and Tuscumbia. Owen was from Brownsville, Ill. and died Sept. 3, 1863.
